intro: Alaternus rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf alaternus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the family. Its aromatic leaves and roots have been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Alaternus rotundifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
